date.value: (str) The date on which the solution was obtained/made public in format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

publication.value: (str or None) The DOI linking to the publication. This will be shown in the summary table.
publication.title: (str or None) A title of any publication that may be associated to the solution.

backend.maximum number of qubits: (int) The maximum number of qubits used in a single quantum circuit.
backend.simulator: (bool) Indacte True for simulator or False for quantum hardware.
backend.name: (str) Name of the backend that run the computation.

model.data: (str) Specify data, e.g., with links to the training and test data files.
model.ansatz: (str) Description of the ansatz or directory to file where the ansatz is saved.
model.optimizer: (str) Description of the optimizer used to train the algorithm.
model.loss: (str) Description of the loss function used to train the algorithm.
model.metadata: A free form dictionary to include additional metrics and information.

performance.file: (str) Path to directory with csv file.
performance.description: The performance is measured with respect to standard ML metrics on training and test data such as accuracy, recall and precision, and defined for each problem as appropriate.

time to solution.value: (float) The time it took to find the solution.
time to solution.unit: (str) The unit in which the time-to-solution is given. This should be 's' to indicate seconds or 'iter' to indicate the number iterations.
time to solution.description: (str) A description of how time to solution is measured.
time to solution.metadata: A free form dictionary to include additional metrics and information.

cost of solution.unit: (str) The unit in which the cost-of-solution is given.
cost of solution.description: (str) A description of how cost-of-solution is measured.
cost of solution.metadata: A free form dictionary to include additional metrics and information.

cost of inference.unit: (str) The unit in which the cost-of-inference is given.
cost of inference.description: (str) A description of how cost-of-inference is measured.
cost of inference.metadata: A free form dictionary to include additional metrics and information.
